resources.string: GeoQuiz2
Canberra is the capital of Australia.
The Pacific Ocean is larger than the Atlantic Ocean.
The Suez Canal connects the Red Sea and the Indian Ocean.
The source of the Nile River is in Egypt.
The Amazon River is the longest river in the Americas.
Lake Baikal is the world\'s oldest and deepest freshwater lake.
The capital of Washington state is Olympia.
Columbus discovered North America in 1492 AD.
The Great Lakes and St. Lawrence River act as a dividing line between the US and Canada.
The highest peak in North America is Mt. Mackenzie, it is also an active volcano.
The largest freshwater lake in the world is Great Bear Lake.
Mexico is known as the \"Sugar Bowl of the World\".
India has 25 states.
Sri Lanka is shaped like a teardrop.
The national animal of Thailand is the Elephant.
The Caucasus and Ural mountain ranges are considered the border between Asia and Europe.
Asia is the second largest continent on Earth.
The smaller part of Russia lies in Asia.
The Alps mountain range passes through Portugal.
Romania is famous for its boot-shaped peninsula.
Europe\'s longest river is the Volga.
Germany is divided in to 16 states.
Mount Elbrus is the tallest mountain in Europe.
The largest country in Europe is Russia. (Hint: it is a transcontinental country!)
True
False
Correct!
